text:
ted men do not have any mature sperm cells in the testes. This form of Y chromosome infertility is called Sertoli cell-only syndrome.  Men with Y chromosome infertility usually do not have any other signs or symptoms. Occasionally they may have unusually small testes or undescended testes (cryptorchidism).",GHR,Y chromosome infertility
How many people are affected by Y chromosome infertility ?,"Y chromosome infertility occurs in approximately 1 in 2,000 to 1 in 3,000 males of all ethnic groups.
